Week of June 15, 2015 <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-labs/p-o-v/the-secret-behind-silicon-valley?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-6-15-15> The Secret Behind Silicon Valley This week, Pivotal’s Rob Mee presented at the Global ICT Summit in Tokyo, Japan. Organized by the Nikkei and the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications, Rob was asked to present on how software is disrupting economies and industries worldwide, and how traditional approaches, paradigms and processes need to change in order to survive in these modern times. READ MORE <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-labs/p-o-v/the-secret-behind-silicon-valley?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-6-15-15> Pivotal Perspectives: Pivotal Cloud Foundry Mobile Push Services June 17, 2015 This week Matt Smith is a guest on the podcast to discuss the Pivotal Cloud Foundry Mobile Push Service that helps provide a reliable, scalable and powerful notification service across all mobile devices with minimum effort.
Listen Now <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/features/pivotal-cloud-foundry-mobile-push-services?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-6-15-15> How Lockheed Martin is Taking on Agile June 05, 2015 How does one of the largest defense companies in the world embrace agile development? Lockheed Martin set out with a strong focus on cultural transformation and security. At Cloud Foundry Summit, the Mission Systems and Training team took the stage to share their experiences in adopting DevOps and Platform as a Service (PaaS).
Read More <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/case-studies-2/how-lockheed-martin-is-taking-on-agile?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-6-15-15> Introducing Atmosphere: A Newsletter on the Cloud-Native Ecosytem June 11, 2015 This is the first issue of Atmosphere—a newsletter covering all things happening in the cloud-native ecosystem. From platforms, containers, IoT, cloud-native application architecture and DevOps, Atmosphere provides a run-down of the information we all want to keep tabs on each month.
